trs: But that woman became a total nerd, as you know.’\footnote{In both \REF{ex:johannessen:4} and \REF{ex:johannessen:5}, the pronoun after the initial noun phrase shows that the initial noun phrase is left-dislocated. Left-dislocation is very common in speech, and is generally used to lift something into focus (FaarlundEtAl1997: 904–908).}
